faq.question: Is the bulk image resizer really free?
faq.answer: Yes, completely free with no limits. Resize up to 20 images at once, and process as many batches as you need. No registration required.

faq.question: What happens to my original images?
faq.answer: Your original images are never modified or uploaded. All processing creates new resized copies in your browser.

faq.question: Can I resize images to different sizes in one batch?
faq.answer: Currently, all images in a batch get the same dimensions. For different sizes, run separate batches or use our individual image resizer.

faq.question: Does this reduce image quality?
faq.answer: Resizing to smaller dimensions maintains quality. Enlarging images may cause pixelation - use our AI upscaler instead for large enlargements.

faq.question: What's the maximum image file size?
faq.answer: Individual images up to 10MB are supported. For very large files, consider resizing in smaller batches.

faq.question: Are my photos uploaded to a server?
faq.answer: No. All processing is done entirely in your browser using the Canvas API. Your photos never leave your device.

limitations: Same dimensions applied to all images in batch
Browser-based processing speed depends on your device

faq.question: How much can I reduce image file size?
faq.answer: Typical compression achieves 50-80% file size reduction. Actual savings depend on the original image - already compressed images benefit less than uncompressed originals.

faq.question: Does compression damage image quality?
faq.answer: Our compression is designed to be visually reversible - files get smaller but images look virtually the same. For photos with heavy compression needs, minor artifacts may appear at extreme settings.

faq.question: Can I compress PNGs with transparency?
faq.answer: Yes, PNG transparency is preserved during compression. Note that JPEG doesn't support transparency - it will become a solid background.

faq.question: What's the difference from the upscaler?
faq.answer: Compressor reduces file size without changing dimensions. Upscaler increases dimensions and improves quality. They serve different purposes - use compressor to save space, upscaler to enlarge.

faq.question: Is this better than Photoshop's Save for Web?
faq.answer: Similar quality compression, but our tool processes batches of 20 images at once instead of one at a time. Plus, it's completely free and runs entirely in your browser.

faq.question: Are my images permanently deleted?
faq.answer: Images never leave your browser from the start. All compression is local and temporary. Nothing is saved to any server.

limitations: Heavily compressed images may show quality loss at extreme settings
Compression speed depends on device and image size
